TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
No, a random images thread would not be fine for the forums no matter its size.

The rules about chat and nonsense threads apply to the entire forums: The Lounge, Forum Games, KSP Discussion; you get the point. **[The announcement about them](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/31593-regarding-fan-threads/)** is located in The Lounge because that's where those threads tend to pop up, but they require too much moderator intervention no matter where they are posted.

You start with a "pool" of 25 reputation to give away. Each reputation takes 24 hours to recharge, and you can't ever have more than 25 reputation in the pool.

When you give rep #1 away, it starts its own countdown timer until you're able to give it away again.

If I give away 1 reputation at 00:21 (Day One) and the remaining reputation at 23:59 Day One), I will need to wait 22 minutes until I have 1 rep in the pool to give away. Once I give that one away, I will need to wait until 23:59 (Day Two) until I can give more away, because the other 24 reputation need to recharge.
